intro: Cybianthus nanayensis, commonly known as the Nanay endemic or Nanay starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
